New Records: South Korea maintained a perfect start in 2026 World Cup qualifying with a 3-0 win over China PR.
Son Heung-min scored twice, including an 11th-minute penalty and a header, becoming a key figure in the match.
Key Match Events: Son Heung-min scored an 11th-minute penalty and a second goal just before halftime.
South Korea's third goal came from Jung Seung-hyun's header after a cross by Son Heung-min in the 87th minute.
Pre-Game Insights: South Korea played in front of a sell-out crowd of over 40,000 in Shenzhen.
Jurgen Klinsmann's side had a strong preparation after a 5-0 win against Singapore.
Post-Match Reflections: The win placed South Korea at the top of Group C with six points.
China PR fell to third in the group, behind Thailand on goal difference.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was significant as South Korea secured their second consecutive win in World Cup qualifying.
